intro: Diphyes triandra, commonly known as the African violet, is a flowering plant native to tropical Africa. It belongs to the family Gesneriaceae and is characterized by its velvety, waxy leaves and showy, tubular flowers. The plant typically grows as a compact shrub with upright stems and clusters of vibrant, colorful blooms. It thrives in well-drained soil and requires indirect sunlight to flourish. Its ornamental value makes it a popular houseplant worldwide.
